page.title: 05EARLY SCHOOLING IN CALOW
page.content: The old school was built about 1870. The children went there from 5 to 11 years of age.The vicar was the Headmaster.There were wooden desks with sloping lids and people carved their names in the wood.It was a stone building with arched windows. The toilets were outside,across the playground.There were 4 classrooms. The Church Hall across the road was used for P.E. and Dancing. In P.E.you did exercises and everyone did the same thing. If you were naughty you had the slipper or the cane. Nearby was a field where you could go for Nature Walks and find butterflies, mice and wild flowers. Separate Infant and Junior Schools were built when more people moved into the area.The old building is to be an Activity Centre.There is already a Boxing Club there.
